page.title: 01General Description
page.content:
The area is gently undulating,mainly rural in nature with a mixture of woodland and farmland with scattered buildings. The two settlements are {Southwick Village,}an estate owned village with thatched cottages and very few modern buildings, in the South East of the area and part of {North Boarhunt}in the North West, consisting of 20th century housing arising initially from the development of market gardening here prior to the First World War
The project was carried out by South Downs College A level Geography students accompanied by their lecturers Olive Haughan and Margaret Price.
